channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘Escape From Tarkov’ Wipe Release Time And Server Downtime Announced
item.description: The next Escape From Tarkov wipe is almost here and now we know exactly when it, and the big new patch, will arrive. But the bad news is there’s a lot of server downtime.

item.title: The prevailing conditions
item.description: It doesn’t matter how hard you try, you’re not going to change the direction of the wind. That doesn’t mean you can’t get good at sailing, though. And yes, if we do try, we can change the conditions in our household, community or workplace. It might feel like wind, but it’s caused by us and […]

item.title: AMD Ryzen 9000 In Surprise Price Cuts
item.description: AMD's new Ryzen desktop processors are seeing early price cuts across the board in a bid to boost sales

item.title: The landlord and the creative coach
item.description: The conflict is real. “Jean-Michel [Basquiat] called,” Mr. Warhol wrote in his diary on Sept. 5, 1983. “He’s afraid he’s just going to be a flash in the pan. And I told him not to worry, that he wouldn’t be. But then I got scared because he’s rented our building on Great Jones and what […]

item.title: Inside The $100 Million Membership Platform For Gen Z Creators
item.description: In an era where digital content creation is becoming a viable career path for many, Fanfix is providing another opportunity for creators to diversify their income.

item.title: In defense of the hard parts
item.description: Yesterday’s post was a little glib. Without a doubt, we add more value when we focus on the emotional labor of important work, leaving others the chance to create commodities. But the repetitive, difficult nature of leaning into commodity production can give us insight, humility and skill. It helps us understand just how hard the […]

item.title: How To Grow A Social Media Following
item.description: Growing a social media following can be frustrating, but there is a simple algorithm hack that will have your account growing in no time, watch this

item.title: The hard parts (and the important parts)
item.description: The hard parts of what you do all day can feel fraught. It’s heavy lifting. Emergencies. Dangerous labor. The stakes are high and the work can be difficult. The important parts of what you do all day are valuable to someone else. This is what you’re getting paid for–solving a customer’s problems. A simple example: […]

item.title: A Psychologist Shares The Life-Changing Stoic Principle Of ‘Amor Fati’
item.description: Instead of instinctively pushing against your fate, try embracing the fate that befalls you. You will find strength and meaning in the very things that test you the most.

item.title: The paradox of lottery thinking
item.description: Tim Brownson points us to this recent poll of people in Great Britain. About one out of four people surveyed (of all ages) believe that they could qualify for the Olympics if they trained for the next four years. This is absurd. It’s the very absurdity of it that makes it common. “I could do […]
